Check out this page:
 http://www.thememoryhole.org/memoryblog-april03.htm
 
 Is that the same guy kissing two different soldiers in two different pictures on the covers of two different magazines? Is that the same guy banging a hammer on Saddam's statue? Or is it two very similar looking guys who shop at the same shirt store?
 
 Then, remember the statue photos?
 http://elongavi.blogspot.com/
 "Only 150 Iraqis showed up, and many of them were part of the puppet Chalabi government."
 
 I would read through all the links on this page to get a more accurate impression on what the true iraqi sentiment toward the occupation is.
 
 I just liked the cover of this book
 http://www.prwatch.org/books/wmd.html
 
 
 I know this is old news, but it coincides with current debates. People in favor of the war say things like "90% of Iraqis are glad we are there." and "Saddam sided with al-qaeda" http://www.washingtonpost.com/ac2/wp-dyn?pagename=article&contentId=A20698-2003Jul20&notFound=true
 
 I'm just drudging these things back up to remind people of the debate a year ago, and hopefully head off anyone trying to take advantage of fuzzy memories, which is the heart of the Bush campaign.

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  Old News (Weapons of Mass Deception)
